statement.p: Given \displaystyle{f{{\left({x},{y}\right)}}}=-{x}^{{4}}+{6}{x}{y}^{{5}}-{4}{y}^{{3}}, find the following numerical values:

ul.li: You will need to substitute the ordered pair (2, 2) into the second partial derivative \displaystyle{\frac{{\partial^{{2}}{f}}}{{\partial{x}^{{2}}}}}{\left({x},{y}\right)} which gives -48
You will need to substitute the ordered pair (2, 2) into the second partial derivative \displaystyle{\frac{{\partial^{{2}}{f}}}{{\partial{x}\partial{y}}}}{\left({x},{y}\right)} which gives 480
